Metaphone 3

Metaphone 3 Toolkit
Class HomeophoneEngine

   in HEngineDLL.h
class HomeophoneEngine

The Homeophone Engine is a class that takes a search string, which is presumed to be a correctly or incorrectly spelled english word, or a name that might be familiar to americans, and returns a ranked list of words found in its dictionary that are calculated to sound similar, according to a programmer-variable definition of similarity. Definitions for these similar sounding words, if present in the database, can also be returned.

The engine operates by first converting the input string into a Metaphone3 "phonetic" encoding, using both the "exact" and vowel-place preserving settings to produce (hopefully) closer matches, and also a regular, more approximate setting where voiced and unvoiced pairs are always mapped to the same "phonetic" representation, and non-initial vowels are not encoded in any form.

The engine then retrieves a list of words found in the HEngineDB database whose (stored, pre-calculated) metaphs match that of the input string. These are then ranked against various vectors to produce a list with the best matches at the beginning of the list. If desired, the associated definitions of the result list words, if any, can also be retrieved.

Edit Distance/Levenshtein Distance match lists are also available, either in a version which only searches against words in the database with the same first letter as the input string, or as a version that ranks against a list of words in the database starting with the same sound as the input string.

Database
The Homeophone Engine cannot function without its database, HEngineDB.mdb, which is an MS Access database, and which should be registered with your Windows system's ODBC Administrator in association with an Access driver, or another database driver that is compatible with .mdb databases, using the name HEngineDB so that the Homeophone Engine DLL will be able to locate it and use it.

Dictionary
The dictionary definitions used by the Homeophone Engine have been supplied by Princeton University's WordNet project, and may be used without restriction as long as the following copyright notice and statements, including the disclaimer, appear on ALL copies of the software, database and documentation, including modifications that you make for internal use or for distribution.

Constructor Detail

HomeophoneEngine

public __declspec( dllexport ) HomeophoneEngine( void );
Homeophone Engine constructor. Opens HEngineDB database and intializes internal database objects. These operations are relatively time consuming, and therefore the Homeophone Engine object should be constructed and deleted as seldom as possible. Also, keep in mind that the Homeophone Engine object owns the memory that the results are returned in, so to be safe, the object should not be deallocated until the program is done with searching and displaying results.

~HomeophoneEngine

public __declspec( dllexport ) ~HomeophoneEngine( void );
Homeophone Engine destructor. Closes the connection to the HEngineDB database and deletes the internal database objects.

Method Detail

GetAlternateMetaph

public __declspec( dllexport ) const char* GetAlternateMetaph( bool exact = EXACT );
Retrieve the alternate Metaphone3 encoding of the input string, if any. Either the "exact" or regular version of the alternate metaph can be called for.
Parameters:
exact - true (EXACT) if the "exact" version of the key is desired, false (APPROXIMATE) for the regular version.
Returns:
a character pointer to the alternate encoded key, if any. If there is no alternate key, a null string will be returned.

GetEditDistanceMatches

public __declspec( dllexport ) multiset< scoredHomeophone >& GetEditDistanceMatches( bool phonetic = PHONETIC );
Retrieve the Edit Distance/Levenshtein Distance matches to the original search string with a Levenshtein distance score of six or less.
Parameters:
phonetic - If phonetic is false, only search words beginning with the same letter as the initial search string. If phonetic is true, search words in the database starting with the same sound as the original search string.
Returns:
a std::multiset collection of scoredHomeophone objects which store the score for each homeophone, but not a definition.

GetMatches

public __declspec( dllexport ) vector< string >& GetMatches( bool exact = EXACT, bool mainMetaph = MAIN_METAPH );
Return a list of matches to the phonetic encoding of the input string ranked by Levenshtein distance. This function allows the calling programmer to specify both whether or not to use the "exact" encoding or the approximate, as well as the primary vs. the alternate encoding.
Parameters:
exact - true (EXACT) if matches against the "exact" encoding are desired, false (APPROXIMATE) if the regular encoding is to be used.
mainMetaph - true (MAIN_METAPH) if matches against the primary encoding are desired, false (ALTERNATE_METAPH) if the alternate encoding is to be used.
Returns:
a std::vector collection of std::string objects.

GetMetaph

public __declspec( dllexport ) const char* GetMetaph( bool exact = EXACT );
Retrieve the primary Metaphone3 encoding of the input string. Either the "exact" or regular version of the primary metaph can be called for.
Parameters:
exact - true (EXACT) if the "exact" version of the key is desired, false (APPROXIMATE) for the regular version.
Returns:
a character pointer to the primary encoded key.

GetResultsList

public __declspec( dllexport ) vector< string >& GetResultsList();
The best available list of homeophone matches against the original search string is ranked for similarity to the original search string in a number of vectors.
Returns:
a std::vector collection of std::string objects.

GetResultsListWithDefinitions

public __declspec( dllexport ) vector< scoredHomeophone >& GetResultsListWithDefinitions( bool getDefinitions = GET_DEFINITIONS );
The best available list of homeophone matches against the original search string is ranked for similarity to the original search in a number of vectors. This list is packaged with the Levenshtein distance scores and definition (if any) for each homeophone match word.
Parameters:
getDefinitions - true (GET_DEFINITIONS) if you want the definitions (if any) of the result words to be returned, false (NO_DEFINITIONS) if not.
Returns:
a std::vector collection of scoredHomeophone objects.

SetWord

public __declspec( dllexport ) void SetWord( char* in );
Sets word to be encoded.
Parameters:
in - pointer to EXTERNALLY ALLOCATED char string of the word to be encoded.
